title: Artist brightens up town with NHS tribute murals
content: This video can not be playedA Yorkshire artist is brightening up her town during the coronavirus outbreak through a series of murals paying tribute to the NHS.Rachel List, 29, has painted a numbers of Banksy-inspired murals around Pontefract with messages such as "stay safe" and "we're all in this together".To keep social distance during lockdown the self-employed artists says she creates the artworks early in the morning as part of her daily exercise."I think people just want to show their appreciation for the NHS," she added."Hopefully I have, in some small way, allowed that message to travel."
